text: <@U2B4QU7U3|karnn> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/karnn/F3LRKPE5D/problem_with_building_fabric.txt|Problem with building fabric>

file.name: Problem_with_building_fabric.txt
file.title: Problem with building fabric
file.preview:
When I try to build fabric using: make 'dist-clean all', in vagrant in the '/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$', I get the following output:

docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-peer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-orderer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-ccenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
file.preview_highlight:
When I try to build fabric using: make 'dist-clean all', in vagrant in the '/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$', I get the following output:


docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-peer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'


docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-orderer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'


docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-ccenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'

text: <@U2B4QU7U3> Looks like you are having trouble reaching <https://index.docker.io>
<@U0KPFAZNF> i've abandoned vagrant and am building directly on the host
ok, though it shouldnt have mattered
it seems you were having trouble reaching DNS at 10.0.2.3
<@U0KPFAZNF> it was probably a port forwarding issue. i couldn't access any address from inside vagrant. but <@U0PB67X4K> advised me(as did the docs) to not use vagrant.
<@U0KPFAZNF> i'm getting a different error when i build: 'make dist-clean all' in $GOPATH/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/.
<@U2B4QU7U3|karnn> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/karnn/F3KF02D7A/building_fabric_without_vagrant.txt|Building fabric without vagrant>
